data.text:
Richard "Ricky" Groves (born April 23, 1968) is an English actor best known for playing Garry Hobbs in EastEnders from 2000-2009. Before his role in EastEnders he appeared in the series Burnside, a spin-off from The Bill. He trained at The Poor School in London.

Career[]

He also appeared in London's Burning (Series 12, Episode 15 on June 16, 2000) as Brett, a lad who is locked in a room with a bomb at a disused swimming pool.

Groves appeared on BBC's School's Out on July 28, 2007, and won $1600 for his school. In the show he revealed his nickname at school was "The Rickster", a name which he is still referred to today by close family and friends.

He participated in the seventh series of Strictly Come Dancing and was paired with professional dancer Erin Boag. They were voted out in Week 10.

He and his family appeared on the sixth series of All Star Family Fortunes.

On February 18, 2010 Groves appeared on The Weakest Link EastEnders Special. He was the second contestant voted off.

Ricky took part in TV series Celebrity Coach Trip partnered with friend Alex Ferns.

In 2011 he appeared in one episode of Holby City, transmitted on July 12.

He participated in the 2011 series of Celebrity MasterChef.

Also took part in the 2014 series of Splash in ITV.

In 2016 he appeared on the ITV programme "Who's Doing the Dishes?"

Personal Life[]

Groves became engaged in 2005 to girlfriend and EastEnders co-star Hannah Waterman who played Laura Beale. The pair married in a ceremony on September 2, 2006, in a country church in Dartmoor. In January 2010, it was announced that Groves and Waterman, were to separate after 3 and a half years of marriage.

He is a keen supporter of Leyton Orient. Groves has also talked of his love of gardening shows on television, and partook in a gardening trivia quiz when he was interviewed by Tony Livesey on Five Live in October 2010.
